intro: Scrophularia anomala, commonly known as yellow root, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. The roots are thick, fleshy, and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
